data.title: Compiler errors when "theora=yes" caused by memcpy
data.body:
When I compile with "theora=yes" in order to enable Theora support, I get the following compile error message:

```
drivers/theoraplayer/video_stream_theoraplayer.cpp:391:38: error: 'memcpy' was not declared in this scope
memcpy(ptr, f->getBuffer(), imgsize);
                                   ^
```

I can workaround this issue on Linux adding the following line:

```
#include <string.h>
```

but I don't know if this could be the solution for all the other platforms.

data.title: Wrong use of | instead of ||
data.body:
In scene/gui/text_edit.cpp, lines 492 and 563, I see:

```
if (cc== '"' | cc == '\'') {
```

Use of | in that context seems to be wrong. It need to be replaced by ||.

data.title: Wrong use of | instead of ||
data.body: Use of | in that context seems to be wrong. It need to be replaced by ||.

data.title: Rich text label crash
data.body:
When trying to resize Rich text label demo example all the way down in godot editor, editor crashes every time, and when trying to resize project window all the way down, it crashes too.  Also there some random crashes when typing long text inside [fill][/fill]
Deleting [fill][/fill] part fixed all the problems.

data.title: text editor autosave interval seconds doesn't work
data.body:
I know this because I have it set to autosave every minute, yet for some reason after an hour of on-and-off typing code, Godot just crashed and I lost all that work.

If this option no longer exists, it's still showing for me in the editor preferences panel.

data.title: Editor::AnimationPlayer::Active dont work in the instanced mode
data.body: If a scene has AnimationPlayer and instanced inside another scene, the main scene can not override the field "Active". The change in state checkbox "active" does not affect the running application.

data.title: Added Visual Studio project generation. Use "vsproj=yes" in command line...
data.body: .... This does not set up NMAKE properly.

data.title: Animations are not saved correctly
data.body:
b2b514367824263e2dc1e26b010b0df63fd3700a broke saving of animations (and maybe other things).

How to reproduce:
- Update an animation
- Save
- All tracks are empty

data.title: Missing return statement
data.body: Detected due to a compiler warning.

data.title: Missing return statement in core/variant.cpp
data.body:
Compiling latest git source code, I got this warning:

```
core/variant.cpp:535:46: warning: equality comparison result unused [-Wunused-comparison]
                        *reinterpret_cast<const Quat*>(_data._mem)==Quat();
                        ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~
```

Looking into the code, it seems that it missing a "return" statement before that comparison, in order to return the bool result.

data.title: Godot 1.1 RC1 causes overheating of the system.
data.body:
Juan is an incredible pain there, I downloaded and unpacked everything, and started checking everything in order, each demo project, as they were in the list from top to bottom, I reached the (kinematic character 3d) and a bit of it to carry out excrement in the running game, I noticed new light and shadow, and there does not exist a fog as before, but then at some terrible moment, my computer just shut down, it was due to overheating! : '(
I know of only one of all the programs that have ever done such a terrible thing as the one that just happened, it was (Torque 3D) there, it happened even open it, completely empty stage.
After that, I had to refuse to work with this, because no one game or a program that did not do this ever.
Â I do not know what triggered such overheating, but I blame the system dynamic light \ shade, I also noticed a lot of light shade, (track town), it looked like a nightmare, and work strange.
Yesterday, I reported about this problem here ... https://www.facebook.com/groups/godotengine/permalink/612012818935316/
I postponed my trip for an indefinite amount of time, now I'm going to give this issue more time ...
PS thanks in advance, I really counting on you.

data.title: Duplicated filter
data.body: ![captura de tela de 2015-05-03 12 10 38](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1387165/7445523/0a6b8e2c-f18e-11e4-8f11-265edbeaf820.png)

data.title: use std::raise to abort the program instead of using null pointer dereference
data.body: Classes like core/map.h, core/hash_map.h and others use null pointer dereference to abort. Please use std::raise to abort, as these null pointer dereference create a lot of false positives in static analysis tools.

data.title: Potential invalid memory access in core/io/resource_format_xml.cpp:315 (cppcheck)
data.body: [core/io/resource_format_xml.cpp:315]: (error) Invalid pointer 'buffptr' after resize().

data.title: Static analysis fixes
data.body: Some problems found by Cppcheck. There are more. I'll file the more tricky ones separately.

data.title: use a text (instead of binary) representation for scene files
data.body:
It would be great if the scene files would be in a text representaion (json, xml, ...) so that they can be better managed by a version control system.

The file could be turned into the current binary format for export afterwards.

data.title: Float rounding
data.body:
``` GDScript
var n1 = floor(0.220 * 100) / 100
var n2 = floor(0.221 * 100) / 100
print(n1) # 0.21 ?
print(n2) # 0.22
print(n1 == 0.21) # false ? (should be false if n1 == 0.22 but should be true if n1 == 0.21)
print(n1 == 0.22) # false ?
print(n2 == 0.22) # false ?
```

data.title: wrong project is played if a  data.pck file exist in the project folder [1.1rc1]
data.body:
If you press run (F5) in the editor and in the same folder of you scene file a data.pck file exist, then the pck file is loaded insted of the scene you are currently editing.

The data.pck file should be ignored in the editor

data.title: [1.1rc1] Exported GDscript float parameters with bounds are exported as integer
data.body:
export(float, 0.0, 10.0) var speed = 0.3

Can only be set to integer values.

Setting no bounds works fine:
export var speed = 0.3

data.title: small bug with Ctrl+B in script editor
data.body: If you try to clone a line with Ctrl+B and you're on the last line of the script, the command simply fails. If you add a new line and then go back up and try again, it works.

data.title: error saving a scene with animationplayer
data.body:
After getting saved an xml scene containing an animationplayer node, opening again the scene an error is returned and the animationplayer no longer has an empty track.

ERROR: _set: Index track out of size (tracks.size()).
   At: scene/resources/animation.cpp:69.
ERROR: _set: Index track out of size (tracks.size()).
   At: scene/resources/animation.cpp:69.
ERROR: _set: Index track out of size (tracks.size()).
   At: scene/resources/animation.cpp:69.

data.title: Fixed some items caught in cppcheck
data.body:
In sprite_3d.cpp the array "flags" is initialized to "FLAG_MAX" which has a value of 2 which would give two indexes 0 and 1, however a loop was accessing it up to index 3 via "i < 4".

Also, simply initialized the next variable to 0 in animation.cpp

data.title: Maybe It's tween callback recursive issue
data.body:
1.1beta
Can't run onIncomplete when I call comeOut function?
[mole game](https://github.com/lulersoft/godot_mole_game/blob/master/mole/mole_sprite.gd#L80)

Like this:

``` gdscript
func comeOut():
    var t=0.3
    tween.interpolate_method(self, "set_pos", get_pos(), to, t, Tween.TRANS_LINEAR, Tween.EASE_IN)
    tween.interpolate_callback(self, t, "onOutcomplete")
#   It's ok when I uncomment
#   var delay=0.5
#   tween.interpolate_method(self, "set_pos", get_pos(), original, t, Tween.TRANS_LINEAR, Tween.EASE_IN,delay)
#   tween.interpolate_callback(self, t+delay, "onIncomplete")

func onOutcomplete():
    var t=0.3
    var delay=0.5
    tween.interpolate_method(self, "set_pos", get_pos(), original, t, Tween.TRANS_LINEAR, Tween.EASE_IN,delay)
    tween.interpolate_callback(self, t+delay, "onIncomplete")

func onIncomplete():
    print "complete"
    pass
```

data.title: Incorrect wording on 1.1 rc1 Website announcement
data.body:
Hey Juan, I was just reading the announcement on the website.

1) For "itâs your change to", "change" should be "chance".

2) "1.0 stable." should be "1.1 stable"

data.title: Export templates for X11 release are bigger than the debug versions
data.body:
linux_x11_64_debug is 6MB, linux_x11_64_release is 26.9 MB.

The release version should be smaller. I think the symbols do not get stripped or the files are swapped or both.

The bug applies to the 32 bit version too.

data.title: [1.1rc1] Delete animations keyframes
data.body:
Just resave my project in 1.1rc1 and all animation key-frames was deleted. Then at run do a massive errors in animation.cpp

ps. Work fine on 25 april build. All scenes saved in .xml format

data.title: load() not working on export
data.body:
I encountered this bug during the last Ludum Dare, and it seems to still be present in 1.1rc1. The load() function works fine in the editor, but fails in exported game with errors like the following:

```
ERROR: load_interactive: Condition ' err!=OK ' is true. returned: Ref<ResourceInteractiveLoader>()
   At: core/io/resource_format_binary.cpp:1006.
ERROR: load: Failed loading resource: debug2.scn
   At: core/io/resource_loader.cpp:204.
```

I've tested it on rc1 in Ubuntu (15.04) and beta1 on Ubuntu (14.10), Windows 8, and OS X 10.10.

data.title: Node.get_child() incorrectly accepts string as parameter
data.body: It should be an error to do Node.get_child("childName"), but there is no error.  It seems to return the first child instead.

data.title: Shader Materials Demo: First object is shaded completely black
data.body:
The shader of the first object "mat1" in the shader materials demo does not work properly on my system. It it displayed completely black.

Godot Version: current master (1.1beta)
OS: Debian GNU/Linux 8.0
GPU: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. [AMD/ATI] RV770 [Radeon HD 4850]
OpenGL vendor string: X.Org
OpenGL renderer string: Gallium 0.4 on AMD RV770
OpenGL core profile version string: 3.3 (Core Profile) Mesa 10.3.2
OpenGL core profile shading language version string: 3.30
